title: account_behavior
label: Account Behavior
description: Records and monitors user account activities and behaviors on the host system for security auditing purposes.

machineCode.label: Machine Code
machineCode.description: Unique identifier of the log source device (device ID), used for cascading. Allowed characters include uppercase and lowercase letters and numbers. If no device ID is available, hardware encoding or license-based unique identifier generation may be referenced.

productVendorName.label: Product Vendor Name
productVendorName.description: Official name of the security product vendor.

deviceSendProductName.label: Device Product Name
deviceSendProductName.description: Official standard name of the software or hardware product that generated the log

deviceName.label: Device Name
deviceName.description: Unique name identifying the log source device, used for asset tracking, log correlation, and device management.

deviceAssetSubTypeId.label: Device Asset Subtype ID
deviceAssetSubTypeId.description: Unique numeric identifier for the device type subcategory.

2.label: Nix
2.description: Unix-like operating systems, including Linux and BSD variants

3.label: Router
3.description: Network routing device used for forwarding data packets between networks.

4.label: Switch
4.description: Network switching device, used to connect devices within a local area network and forward data frames.

5.label: VPN
5.description: Virtual Private Network (VPN) device, providing secure remote access and site-to-site connectivity.

6.label: Load Balancing
6.description: Load balancing device, used for distributing network traffic to improve performance and reliability.

7.label: Firewall
7.description: A network security device used to control inbound and outbound network traffic based on security rules.

8.label: Network Gate
8.description: Network isolation device used for secure data exchange between networks with different security levels.

9.label: Intrusion Detection System
9.description: Intrusion Detection System (IDS), used to monitor network or system activities for detecting malicious behaviors.

10.label: Intrusion Prevention System
10.description: The Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) actively blocks malicious traffic upon detecting threats.

11.label: Unified Threat Management
11.description: Unified Threat Management (UTM) device, integrating multiple security functions such as firewall, antivirus, and intrusion prevention.

12.label: Next Generation Firewall
12.description: Next-generation firewall, providing application layer inspection, deep packet inspection, and advanced threat protection.

13.label: Web Application Firewall
13.description: Web Application Firewall, specifically designed to protect web applications from attacks such as SQL injection and XSS.

14.label: Traffic Monitoring Device
14.description: Network traffic monitoring device, used for real-time analysis and monitoring of network traffic patterns.

15.description: Web page tamper-proof system, designed to protect website content from unauthorized modifications.

16.label: DDoS Mitigation System
16.description: Anti-Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) protection system, mitigating DDoS attacks to safeguard service availability.

17.label: Antivirus System
17.description: Antivirus system, which detects and removes malware, viruses, and trojans.

18.label: Counterintelligence System
18.description: Anti-spyware system designed to prevent spyware from stealing sensitive information and monitoring user activities.

19.label: Data Leakage Prevention System
19.description: Data Leakage Prevention (DLP) system, designed to monitor and prevent sensitive data from being leaked through various channels.

20.label: Email Audit System
20.description: Email auditing system, monitoring and auditing email content to comply with security policies and regulatory requirements.

21.label: Identity Management System
21.description: Identity and Access Management system, managing user authentication, authorization, and permissions.

22.label: Traffic Scrubbing System
22.description: Traffic scrubbing system, filtering malicious traffic to protect network resources and ensure business continuity.

23.label: Database Audit System
23.description: Database auditing system that monitors and records database access, operations, and permission changes.

24.label: Web Audit System
24.description: Web auditing system, auditing access, operations, and security events of web applications.

25.label: Operational Audit System
25.description: Operation and maintenance auditing system, which monitors and records system operation and maintenance activities to prevent unauthorized access.

26.label: Internet Behavior Audit System
26.description: Internet behavior auditing system, which monitors and audits employees' network usage to ensure compliance with security policies.

27.label: Unified Audit Gateway
27.description: Unified Audit Gateway, which centrally collects, normalizes, and analyzes various types of audit logs.

28.label: Log Audit System
28.description: The log auditing system collects, stores, analyzes, and alerts on system security logs.

29.label: Security Management System
29.description: Security management system that integrates security management functions such as policy management, risk management, and incident response.

30.label: Honeypot System
30.description: Honeypot system, designed to deceive attackers for the purpose of collecting attack information and analyzing attack techniques.

31.label: Application Scanner
31.description: Application vulnerability scanner, designed to detect security vulnerabilities in web applications and mobile applications.

32.label: Network Scanner
32.description: Network vulnerability scanner, which scans network devices, services, and ports to identify security vulnerabilities.

33.label: Host Scanner
33.description: Host vulnerability scanner, scanning for operating system and application vulnerabilities as well as configuration issues.

34.label: Web Server
34.description: Web server software, such as IIS, Apache, Nginx, etc., used for hosting websites and applications.

35.description: 数据库服务器软件，如MySQL、Oracle、SQL Server等，存储和管理数据

36.description: Mail server software, such as Exchange, Postfix, etc., handles the sending and receiving of emails.

37.label: Storage Server
37.description: Storage server, providing data storage, backup, and sharing services.

38.label: FTP Server
38.description: FTP server, providing File Transfer Protocol services, supporting file upload and download.

39.label: Application Server
39.description: Application server, which runs enterprise applications and business logic, such as Java EE and .NET applications.

43.label: Windows Audit Agent
43.description: Windows System Audit Agent, collects Windows event logs and system activities.

44.label: Nix Audit Agent
44.description: Unix-like system audit agent that collects Linux/Unix system logs and audit data

45.label: WMI Audit Agent
45.description: Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) auditing agent, which collects system information and events through WMI.

51.label: Collector
51.description: Log collector, which gathers and forwards log data from various data sources.

52.label: Communication Server
52.description: Communication server, responsible for network communication, message delivery, and protocol conversion.

53.label: Correlation Engine
53.description: Security event correlation engine, which analyzes log data to detect complex security incidents.

56.label: Endpoint Detection and Response System
56.description: Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) system, which monitors host activities, detects threats, and responds to security incidents.

57.label: Virtualization Device
57.description: Virtualization platform devices, such as VMware ESXi and Hyper-V, which run virtual machines.

58.label: Network Printer
58.description: Network-connected printer device supporting network printing functionality.

59.label: APT
59.description: Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) detection system, designed for monitoring and protecting against APT attacks.

60.label: DNS Server
60.description: Domain Name System server, providing domain name resolution services and DNS security protection.

61.label: API Risk Monitoring System
61.description: API risk monitoring system, which monitors security risks and usage anomalies of API interfaces.

62.label: API Security Gateway
62.description: API security gateway that protects API interfaces from attacks, providing authentication, authorization, and rate limiting.

63.label: Vulnerability Scanning System
63.description: Vulnerability scanning system that comprehensively scans for system, network, and application vulnerabilities.

65.label: UES
65.description: Unified Endpoint Security System, integrating endpoint protection, detection, and response capabilities.

deviceAddress.label: Device IP Address
deviceAddress.description: IP address of the log production device

eventId.label: Event ID
eventId.description: Globally unique identifier for log events, typically generated using non-repetitive algorithms such as UUID or timestamp sequences.

name.label: Summary Name
name.description: Summary name of the log or alert

message.label: Message Description
message.description: Detailed description information of the log or alert

startTime.label: Start Time
startTime.description: The precise timestamp when the event activity began.

endTime.label: End Time
endTime.description: The precise timestamp marking the end of an event activity.

deviceReceiptTime.label: Device Receipt Time
deviceReceiptTime.description: The precise timestamp when the device locally receives and generates a log event.

collectorReceiptTime.label: Collector Receipt Time
collectorReceiptTime.description: The exact timestamp when the log collection system receives the log event.

severity.label: Severity Level
severity.description: Indicates the severity level of the security threat for logs or alerts. 0: No risk, 1-3: Low risk, 4-6: Medium risk, 7-9: High risk, 10: Critical.

catOutcome.label: Category Outcome
catOutcome.description: Indicates the final result status of an event operation or attack.

OK.label: Success
OK.description: It is reasonable to infer that the event has been successfully executed.

FAIL.label: Failure
FAIL.description: It is reasonable to infer that the event has failed.

Attempt.label: Attempt
Attempt.description: The event has occurred, but its success or failure cannot be determined.

logType.label: Log Type
logType.description: Identifies the functional or object entity classification of the log event.

alert.label: Alert
alert.description: Security alert event logs, including threat detection, anomalous behavior, and security risk alerts.

traffic.label: Network Traffic
traffic.description: Network traffic and communication session logs, recording network connections, data transmissions, and protocol communications.

process.label: Process
process.description: Process lifecycle management logs, recording operations such as process creation, termination, and injection.

command.label: Command Execution
command.description: Command line and script execution logs, recording system commands, PowerShell and Shell command executions.

file.label: File
file.description: File system operation logs, recording operations such as file creation, modification, deletion, and access.

account.label: Account
account.description: User account management logs, recording user login, logout, permission changes, and account management operations.

config.label: Configuration
config.description: System configuration change log, recording security policy, system settings, and configuration modification operations.

status.label: System Status
status.description: System operational status logs, recording system startup, shutdown, reboot, and operational status changes.

system_operation.label: System Operation Log
system_operation.description: System-level administrative operation logs, recording system maintenance, management, and control operations.

system_resource.label: System Resource
system_resource.description: System resource usage logs, recording CPU, memory, disk, and network resource utilization.

domain.label: Domain
domain.description: Domain name resolution and query logs, recording DNS queries, domain name resolution, and network positioning operations.

registry.label: Registry Operation Log
registry.description: Windows registry operation logs, recording the creation, modification, and deletion of registry keys and values.

app.label: Application
app.description: Application runtime logs, recording application startup, operation, errors, and business operations.

service.label: Service
service.description: System service management logs, recording the creation, startup, shutdown, and configuration changes of Windows/Linux services.

task.label: Task
task.description: Scheduled tasks and job logs, recording the creation, execution, modification, and deletion operations of scheduled tasks.

thread.label: Thread Operation Log
thread.description: Thread management logs, recording operations such as thread creation, termination, suspension, and priority changes.

module.label: Module
module.description: Program module management logs, recording the loading, unloading, and memory mapping of modules such as DLLs and SOs.

driver.label: Driver Operation Log
driver.description: Device driver logs, recording the loading, unloading, and operational status of kernel drivers.

pipe.label: Pipe Operation Log
pipe.description: Inter-process communication logs, recording named pipe creation, connection, and data transfer operations.

wmi.label: WMI Operation Class Log
wmi.description: Windows Management Instrumentation operation logs, recording WMI queries, event subscriptions, and code execution.

winrm.label: Windows Remote Management
winrm.description: Windows Remote Management logs, recording remote PowerShell command execution and system administration operations.

others.label: Other Log Types
others.description: Unclassified other log types, containing log events that cannot be categorized into the above classifications.

opType.label: Operation Type
opType.description: Identifies the specific type of operation performed in the event.

read.label: Read
read.description: Data read operations, including file reading, registry querying, memory reading, etc.

write.label: Write
write.description: Data write operations, including file writes, registry modifications, configuration changes, etc.

create.label: Create
create.description: New object creation operations, including file creation, process creation, user account creation, etc.

delete.label: Delete
delete.description: Object deletion operations, including file deletion, registry key deletion, user account deletion, etc.

modify.label: Modify
modify.description: Modify object attributes operation, including file attribute modification, permission changes, configuration adjustments, etc.

login.label: Login
login.description: Successful authentication operations, including system login, application login, remote access login, etc.

logout.label: Logout
logout.description: Session termination operations, including user logout, session timeout, and forced logout.

execute.label: Execute
execute.description: Program execution operations, including process initiation, command execution, script running, etc.

start.label: Start
start.description: Service startup operations, including system service initiation, scheduled task triggering, daemon process startup, etc.

stop.label: Stop
stop.description: Service stop operations, including system service termination, process killing, and task completion.

access.label: Access
access.description: Resource access operations, including process access, memory access, shared resource access, etc.

connect.label: Connection
connect.description: Network connection operations, including network connection establishment, session creation, remote connections, etc.

load.label: Load
load.description: Module loading operations, including driver loading, DLL loading, plugin loading, etc.

send.label: Send
send.description: Data transmission operations, including network data transmission, email sending, message sending, etc.

receive.label: Receive
receive.description: Data reception operations, including network data reception, email reception, message reception, etc.

combine.label: Combination Operation
combine.description: Composite operation type, indicating the combined execution of multiple operations.

query.label: Query
query.description: Data query operations, including database queries, directory queries, information retrieval, etc.

rename.label: Rename
rename.description: Object renaming operations, including file renaming, account renaming, service renaming, etc.

listen.label: Listen
listen.description: Network monitoring operations, including port monitoring, session monitoring, event monitoring, etc.

setValue.label: Set Value
setValue.description: Key-value setting operations, including registry key settings, configuration parameter settings, environment variable settings, etc.

addedGroup.label: Added Group
addedGroup.description: Group member addition operations, including adding users to groups, computers joining domains, etc.

removedGroup.label: Removed Group
removedGroup.description: Group member removal operations, including user removal from groups and computer disjoining from domains.

changePassword.label: Change Password
changePassword.description: Password modification operations, including user password changes, service account password updates, etc.

resetPassword.label: Reset Password
resetPassword.description: Password reset operations, including administrator-initiated password resets for users, password recovery, etc.

disable.label: Disable
disable.description: Object disable operations, including user account deactivation, service deactivation, policy deactivation, etc.

enable.label: Enable
enable.description: Object activation operations, including user account activation, service activation, policy activation, etc.

lock.label: Lock
lock.description: Object locking operations, including user account locking, session locking, resource locking, etc.

unlock.label: Unlock
unlock.description: Object unlock operations, including user account unlocking, session unlocking, resource unlocking, etc.

eventCount.label: Event Count
eventCount.description: Count the occurrences of the same type or related events.

dataSourceAddress.label: Data Source Address
dataSourceAddress.description: Device address of the data source

srcUserName.label: Source User Name
srcUserName.description: The principal user identity name that initiates network connections, system access, or security events.

srcNtDomain.label: Source NT Domain
srcNtDomain.description: The Windows NT domain name to which the source device belongs.

srcLoginId.label: Source Login ID
srcLoginId.description: User login identifier used to initiate operations or requests in network communications.

srcUserId.label: Source User ID
srcUserId.description: Unique ID of the user who initiated the operation or request in network communication.

destNtDomain.label: Destination NT Domain
destNtDomain.description: The Windows NT domain name to which the destination device belongs.

destUserId.label: Destination User ID
destUserId.description: Unique identifier of the target user for security operations

privilegeList.label: Privilege List
privilegeList.description: The set of permissions owned by the system or file, used to describe access control privileges.

samAccountName.label: SAM Account Name
samAccountName.description: User login name in the Security Account Manager (SAM)

userPrincipalName.label: User Principal Name
userPrincipalName.description: User Principal Name (UPN) of the service for client authentication.

homeDir.label: Home Directory
homeDir.description: The complete path of the user's personal file storage home directory, supporting both local paths and network UNC path formats.

homePath.label: Home Path
homePath.description: Local path pointing to the user's home directory or environment variable resolution path.

scriptPath.label: Script Path
scriptPath.description: The full path of the executed script file in the file system.

confPath.label: Configuration File Path
confPath.description: Configuration file storage path for applications or system services

userWorkstations.label: User Workstations
userWorkstations.description: A comma-separated list of NetBIOS or DNS names of computers from which the user can log in.

timePasswordLastSet.label: Time Password Last Set
timePasswordLastSet.description: Records the timestamp of the user's last password modification.

expirationTime.label: Expiration Time
expirationTime.description: The expiration date of the domain name registration.

primaryGroupId.label: Primary Group ID
primaryGroupId.description: Unique identifier of the user's primary group

delegationList.label: Delegation List
delegationList.description: A list of objects to which a user or service principal is permitted to delegate their permissions or delegated authorizations.

oldUacValue.label: Old UAC Value
oldUacValue.description: The User Account Control (UAC) value of the user account before modification.

newUacValue.label: New UAC Value
newUacValue.description: User account after modification of User Account Control (UAC) value

userAccountControl.label: User Account Control
userAccountControl.description: Windows Active Directory user account control attribute is a bitmask used to represent various account settings.

userParameters.label: User Parameters
userParameters.description: Custom configuration parameters for Active Directory user accounts

sidHistory.label: SID History
sidHistory.description: The SID history attribute of an Active Directory object

userLoginHours.label: User Login Hours
userLoginHours.description: The login time limit of the user account. It defines the time range that users can log in to the system

hostAddress.label: Host IP Address
hostAddress.description: The network IP address of the host

deviceVersion.label: Device Version
deviceVersion.description: Identifies the complete version information of the device firmware, operating system, or embedded software.
